x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Implement a secure system for reporting and tracking safety incidents on campus. ServiceNow can route reports to appropriate authorities, automate follow-ups, and provide analytics to help improve policies and prevention strategies.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  • ServiceNow Incident Management: For logging, categorizing, and tracking safety reports.
  • Flow Designer and Automation Engine: To automate routing, notifications, and follow-up tasks.
  • Service Portal: Provides an intuitive, secure front-end for students and staff to submit reports and check status.
  • Performance Analytics: For real-time dashboards and trend analysis on incident data.
  • Mobile App Capabilities: Allowing users to report incidents or receive alerts on-the-go.
  • Virtual Agent (Optional): To guide users through reporting or provide safety resources via chat.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • User Authentication Integration: Connect with campus identity management systems (e.g., SSO, LDAP) for secure login.
  • Data Privacy and Security Controls: Ensure compliance with campus data policies and legal requirements for confidentiality.
  • Integration with Campus Security Systems: Optionally link to existing emergency alert systems, CCTV, or access control where available.
  • Mobile Device Support: For app-based reporting and notifications.
  • Analytics and Reporting Tools: For advanced data visualization and export capabilities.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • User Adoption: Ensuring students and staff are aware of and trust the system to report sensitive incidents.
  • Data Sensitivity: Managing confidential information with strict access controls and audit trails.
  • Integration Complexity: Connecting with diverse campus systems (security, HR, student records) may require custom development.
  • Incident Verification: Establishing workflows for triaging and validating reports to avoid misuse or false alarms.
  • Change Management: Training security staff and administrators to use new workflows and analytics tools.
  • Mobile Accessibility: Ensuring the solution works effectively on all devices and is accessible to users with disabilities.
